content: Legacy Organization Insight discovered: Bank of America program since 2004 partners with established nonprofits. 'Partners also probably old.' Frame issues as longstanding (education inequality) vs trendy (AI ethics). Strategic alignment increases selection probability.

Scale Amplification Framework deployed: 'Focus on the scale of your impact, like the bigger the better.' Evolution from individual tutoring → policy advocacy → legislative change. DC connection: 'Taking students to DC to meet legislators.' Systemic beats novel.

Why Ladder Technique reveals depth: 'Why is diversity important?' moves from 'different perspectives' to 'products impact everyone' to 'life and death consequences.' Seatbelt example shows tangible harm. Transforms cosmetic to critical importance.

Teacher recommendation navigation: CS teacher 'refused to be Empowering AI advisor... said she's really busy.' Jenny guides diversification: History teacher (2 years trust) + Media arts (leadership witness). Preserves relationships while securing support.

Challenge pivot executed: Original 'gender leadership gap' → consideration of 'violence in community' → final 'education resource inequality.' Reasoning: Better alignment with tutoring solution. Real-time strategic adaptation based on strengths.

Essay Recycling Architecture: 'Everything will start to come together... take bits and pieces from other essays.' NCWIT content reusable. Build modular blocks for multiple applications. Document outside platform for version control.

Measurable achievements: Film club transformed from all-boys to 60% female officers. Two community challenges identified and framed. Teacher recommenders selected. Essay prompts documented separately. Strategic insights about legacy organization preference captured.

Multi-channel support deployed: Screen sharing for application navigation, Google Docs for essay drafting, real-time partner research during session. 'Text me after your SAT tomorrow' extends support beyond session boundaries.

Word count shock shared: '2000-4000 words?' Jenny: 'That's so much... that's so much.' Knowledge limits admitted: 'I don't think they say anything' about partners. Makes challenges feel manageable through shared surprise.

Community Impact Layers revealed: Individual (direct tutoring) → Organizational (resource systems) → Policy (legislative advocacy) → Systemic (education funding reform). Each layer exponentially increases impact scale. DC connection validates policy focus.
